20049500: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.
20049600: It moves along the ground as if sliding. Its swift movements befuddle its foes, and it then attacks with a vine whip.
20049700: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior’s noble eyes.
20049800: It can deftly dodge its foe’s attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.
20049900: The more it eats, the more fuel it has to make the fire in its stomach stronger. This fills it with even more power.
20050000: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.
20050100: The scalchop on its stomach isn’t just used for battle—it can be used to break open hard berries as well.
20050200: Strict training is how it learns its flowing double-scalchop technique.
20050300: In the time it takes a foe to blink, it can draw and sheathe the seamitars attached to its front legs.
20050800: Its fur is long and thick. A long time ago in cold regions, every household kept a Stoutland.
20050900: Its cute act is a ruse. When victims let down their guard, they find their items taken. It attacks with sharp claws.
20051000: Their beautiful form comes from the muscles they have developed. They run silently in the night.
20051800: The mist emanating from their foreheads is packed with the dreams of people and Pokémon.
20052300: When this ill-tempered Pokémon runs wild, it shoots lightning from its mane in all directions.
20052400: The hexagonal hole is its ear. Deep in that ear is an energy core, so if you stick your hand in there, Roggenrola will be very angry!
20052500: The energy overflowing from its body has turned into orange crystals that are hard enough to smash diamonds.
20052600: When it fires off energy with all its might, the power creates countless fissures on its body.
20053000: It can help in tunnel construction. Its drill has evolved into steel strong enough to bore through iron plates.
20053400: It is thought that Conkeldurr taught humans how to make concrete more than 2,000 years ago.
20053600: When they vibrate the bumps on their heads, they can make waves in water or earthquake-like vibrations on land.
20053700: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.
20053800: When it tightens its belt, it becomes stronger. Wild Throh use vines to weave their own belts.
20053900: Desiring the strongest karate chop, they seclude themselves in mountains and train without sleeping.
20054200: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.
20054400: Protected by a hard shell, it spins its body like a wheel and crashes furiously into its enemies.
20054500: It clasps its prey with the claws on its neck until it stops moving. Then it finishes it off with deadly poison.
20054600: To protect itself, it shoots cotton from its body. When it gets wet in the rain, its cotton grows moist and heavy, and it can’t move as well.

20055011: Savage, violent Pokémon, red and blue Basculin are always fighting each other over territory.
20055300: When it spots prey, even at a distance of over 30 miles, it swims through the desert as if it were water, then jumps out and chomps them.
20056100: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.
20056500: Its jaws are terrifyingly powerful. It could eat Omastar and Omanyte whole and not be bothered in the slightest by their shells.

20057100: It doesn’t just transform itself—it also has the power to make hundreds of people see its illusions.
20057900: They use psychic power to control their arms, which are made of a special liquid. They can crush boulders psychically.
20058100: Despite their elegant appearance, they can flap their wings strongly and fly for thousands of miles.
20058400: It blasts blizzards from its two mouths. It can create snow anywhere, so it gets a lot of love from skiers and snowboarders.
20058512: Their coloring changes according to the seasons and can be slightly affected by the temperature and humidity as well.
20058700: They store up electricity to fly through the air. When thunder cracks at night, sometimes there are almost enough of them to blot out the sky.
20058900: Wearing the shell covering they stole from Shelmet, they defend themselves and attack with two lances.

20059900: Interlocking two bodies and spinning around generates the energy they need to live.
20060700: While shining a light and pretending to be a guide, it leeches off the life force of any who follow it.
20060900: Being consumed in Chandelure’s flame burns up the spirit, leaving the body behind.
20061000: They use their tusks to crush the berries they eat. Repeated regrowth makes their tusks strong and sharp.
20061200: They are kind but can be relentless when defending territory. They challenge foes with tusks that can cut steel.
20061500: They are born in snow clouds. They use chains made of ice crystals to capture prey.
20061700: Having removed its heavy shell, it becomes very light and can fight with ninja-like movements.
20062500: No matter how strong the Bisharp, it’s said that if the blade on its head is chipped, it will retire from its position as the boss.
20062800: The more scars it has on its front, the more heroic it’s considered to be. Those with many scars on their back are mocked by the flock.
20063300: They cannot see, so they tackle and bite to learn about their surroundings. Their bodies are covered in wounds.
20063500: The heads on their arms do not have brains. They use all three heads to consume and destroy everything.
20063700: As it flies, it scatters its flaming scales. It was feared by ancient people, who referred to it as “the rage of the sun.”
20063800: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.
20064112: In every direction it flies, creating winds so powerful, they blow everything away.
20064300: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.
20064400: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with lightning. It assists those who want to build an ideal world.
20064611: This legendary ice Pokémon waits for a hero to fill in the missing parts of its body with truth or ideals.
20064712: It crosses the world, running over the surfaces of oceans and rivers. It appears at scenic waterfronts.
20071700: Eating a twig fills it with energy, and its roomy ears give vent to air hotter than 390 degrees Fahrenheit.
20071800: It has a twig stuck in its tail. With friction from its tail fur, it sets the twig on fire and launches into battle.
20071900: It gazes into the flame at the tip of its branch to achieve a focused state, which allows it to see into the future.
20072300: It secretes flexible bubbles from its chest and back. The bubbles reduce the damage it would otherwise take when attacked.
20072400: It can throw bubble-covered pebbles with precise control, hitting empty cans up to a hundred feet away.
20072500: It creates throwing stars out of compressed water. When it spins them and throws them at high speed, these stars can split metal in two.
20075300: While it’s an amiable Pokémon, if you touch it unexpectedly, it will heat up its body in an instant, and you’ll be burned.
20070400: When they’re young, they live with a pride. Once they’re able to hunt prey on their own, they’re kicked out and have to make their own way.
20071311: It’s not safe without the power of a flower, but it will keep traveling around until it finds one with the color and shape it wants.
20073300: The organ that emits its intense psychic power is sheltered by its ears to keep power from leaking out.
20073400: When in danger, it raises its ears and releases enough psychic power to grind a 10-ton truck into dust.
20074611: Generations of kings were attended by these Pokémon, which used their spectral power to manipulate and control people and Pokémon.

20074200: To entangle its opponents in battle, it extrudes white threads as sweet and sticky as cotton candy.
20075700: It compresses the water it has sucked up and then projects it with enough power to punch a hole right through a thick sheet of iron.
20073200: They flare their frills and generate energy. A single Heliolisk can generate sufficient electricity to power a skyscraper.
20073900: It lived in cold areas in ancient times. It’s said that when Amaura whinnies, auroras appear in the night sky.

20076700: Once a fight breaks out, it will unflinchingly charge at dragon Pokémon that are many times larger than itself.
20076300: It uses its horns to check out its surroundings. They’re very sensitive, so if you grab them, it will feel a strong shock and be unable to move.
20073511: The pumpkin body is inhabited by a spirit trapped in this world. As the sun sets, it becomes restless and active.
20075100: Its ice-covered body is as hard as steel. Its cumbersome frame crushes anything that stands in its way.
20076800: Legends say it can share eternal life. It slept for a thousand years in the form of a tree before its revival.
20076900: When this legendary Pokémon’s wings and tail feathers spread wide and glow red, it absorbs the life force of living creatures.

20077200: A sudden transformation of Carbink, its pink, glimmering body is said to be the loveliest sight in the whole world.
20077400: In its true form, it possess a huge amount of power. Legends of its avarice tell how it once carried off an entire castle to gain the treasure hidden within.
20084100: It sends its feathers, which are as sharp as blades, flying in attack. Its legs are strong, so its kicks are also formidable.
20084200: This narcissistic Pokémon is a clean freak. If you don’t groom it diligently, it will stop listening to you.

20086000: It stores coldness in its pincers and pummels its foes. It can even smash thick walls of ice to bits!

2008350000:
This Pokémon is very popular as a herding dog in the
Galar region. As it runs, it generates electricity from the
base of its tail.
2008551100: Trainers Polteageist trusts will be allowed to experience its distinctive flavor and aroma firsthand by sampling just a tiny bit of its tea.
2008610000: With the hair wrapped around its body helping to enhance its muscles, this Pokémon can overwhelm even Machamp.
2008620031: Its voice is staggering in volume. Obstagoon has a tendency to take on a threatening posture and shout—this move is known as Obstruct.

2008691111: When it trusts a Trainer, it will treat them to berries it’s decorated with cream.
2008751100:
This Pokémon keeps its heat-sensitive head cool with ice.
It fishes for its food, dangling its single hair into the sea to
lure in prey.
2008751200:
The ice covering this Pokémon’s face has shattered,
revealing a slightly worried expression that many people
are enamored with.
2008771100: It carries electrically roasted seeds with it as if they’re precious treasures. No matter how much it eats, it always gets hungry again in short order.
2008771200: Intense hunger drives it to extremes of violence, and the electricity in its cheek sacs has converted into a Dark-type energy.
2008840000: The special metal that composes its body is very light, so this Pokémon has considerable agility. It lives in caves because it dislikes the rain.

2008891200: Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master’s Shield. It was feared and respected by all.
2008900000: It was inside a meteorite that fell 20,000 years ago. There seems to be a connection between this Pokémon and the Dynamax phenomenon.
20086512:
This is its form while it is devouring the light of Solgaleo.
It pounces on foes and then slashes them with the claws
on its four limbs and back.
20086514:
This is its form when it has absorbed overwhelming light
energy. It fires laser beams from all over its body.
2008980012:
According to lore, this Pokémon showed no mercy to those
who got in its way, yet it would heal its opponents’
wounds after battle.
